intro: Proiphys alba, commonly known as the white proiphys, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, white petals and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with high rainfall. Its flowering season occurs during the spring, and it produces small, fragrant flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Proiphys alba is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
